materials]]

Activity 1: As Girls Arrive

  • Brownie Elf Kaper Chart template

  • Kaper Chart

  • Scissors

  • Crayons/markers/colored pencils

  • Masking tape

  • Poster Board Kaper Chart

    • Activity 2: Opening Ceremony — Our Big Adventure

  • Girl Scout Promise and Law

  • Poster Board with the Promise and Law

  • Brownie Adventure Map

    • Activity 3: Sample Activity — Brownie Badge Year

  • Brownie Badges

  • 1 or 2 small bags of original flavored Skittles

  • Bowl or bag

    • Activity 4: Sample Activity — A World of Girls Journey Year

  • A World of Girls Journey Awards

  • Map or globe with countries and states clearly visible

  • Biscuits, scones, shortbread or other English snack

    • Activity 5: Sample Activity — WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Year

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Two bottles of water (one clean and one with dirt and leaves)

    • Activity 6: Sample Activity — Brownie Quest Journey Year

  • Brownie Quest Journey

  • Brownie ELF Clues

  • Apples ( 1 apple per 3 girls)

  • Apple corer (to core and slice the apples)

  • Peanut Butter (for peanut allergies substitute frosting or cream cheese)

  • Bag of small white marshmallows

  • Plastic knives

  • Small baggies

    • Activity 7: Team Decision: Choose Your Brownie Track

  • Brownie Badges

  • A World of Girls Journey Awards

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Brownie Quest Journey Awards

  • Sticky dots, stickers or post it notes (1 per girl)

  • Tape

    • Activity 8: Closing Ceremony: Friendship Circle

  • None

    • [[_

overview.str:
overview]]

This meeting will introduce girls to the Girl Scout Leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges so they can choose a Brownie “track” for the year.

In this meeting, girls will:

  • Be introduced to all three leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges

  • Do sample activities from each of the three Journeys and a sample badge activity

  • Choose one of four tracks to help plan their year.

    • Prepare Ahead

  • Pre-cut the Brownie Elf Kaper template so they are ready for girls to color.

  • Make a simple Kaper Chart on poster board with the dates of your meeting along the left side and the jobs along the top, such as opening, hostess, clean-up, closing.

  • Post the Girl Scout Promise and Law on Poster Board so the girls can read it from the Brownie Circle.

  • Put the Skittles in a bowl or a bag for activity 3.

  • For activity 5, pour some water out of one water bottle, add some dirt and leaves, put the cap on and shake it up.

  • For the Brownie Smile snack, prepare enough baggies of peanut butter and baggies of marshmallows (18 in each baggie) for each group of three to have one.

  • Hide the apples and baggies in places where they’re fairly easy to find.

  • Prepare the Brownie ELF Clues handout.

    • Get Help from Your Friends and Family Network

    Your Friends and Family Network can include:

  • The Brownies’ parents, aunts, uncles, older siblings, etc.

  • Cadettes who are interested in earning their LiA Award

  • Other volunteers who have offered to help with the meeting

    • Ask them how they can pitch in. For example, they might want to:

  • Bring snacks

  • Help welcome girls to the meeting

  • Gather materials for activities

  • Guide the girls in one of the activities

  • Or just be ready to take care of small problems (spilled juice!), hand out art supplies (share the crayons, please!) or act as cheerleaders!

    • Tip: This meeting will take the full 1 ½ hours, so plan accordingly. Try to recruit a few adults to help at the meeting keep things running smoothly. If you have a large group of girls and enough adult helpers, you may consider splitting the girls up into three groups for activities 3,4, and 5 and running the activities as 10-minute stations. The three groups would rotate through the stations and then come back together as a group for activity number 6. There will be several small snacks that girls will eat throughout the meeting.

    Award Connection

    Girls will be doing activities to help them make decisions to plan their troop year. Girls will decide whether they want to choose a Journey track or the badge track.

    There are three Journey tracks: Brownie Quest, WOW! Wonders of Water, and A World of Girls. On a Journey track, girls will be able to complete a Journey, including a Take Action project, and earn a couple of badges.

    On a badge track, girls earn a number of badges and complete a small Take Action project.

    Meeting Length

    90 minutes, including 10 minutes for setup and cleanup.

    If girls were Brownies last year and have already completed a Journey, just omit that Journey as a choice for this year and spend more time on the other activities.

    The times given for each activity will be different, depending on how many girls are in the troop.

    [[_

B14B015.agenda: \[1-Opening Ceremony-10] [2-Make Something Bubble Up-10] [3-Homemade Silly Putty-20] [4-Snack Chat-10] [5-Take Action Pause-10] [6-Closing Ceremony-5]
B14B015.name: Home Scientist 15

collection-element.activityDescription:
Materials

  • Brownie Elf Kaper Chart template

  • Kaper Chart

  • Scissors

  • Crayons/markers/colored pencils

  • Masking Tape

  • Poster Board Kaper Chart

    • Time Allotment

  • 5 minutes

    • Steps:

    Have the supplies setup for girls to color their Elf Kaper square so that girls can start coloring them as they wait for others to arrive.

    Instructions:

    Let girls color the elf any way they’d like.

    Have each girl write her name on the line.

    The first girls to arrive at the meeting can choose the kaper they’d like to do at today’s meeting by placing their elf on the Kaper Chart. The remaining girls will be rotated in for all future meetings so that everyone gets a turn to try all the kapers.

    [[Activity
collection-element.name: As Girls Arrive

collection-element_x005b_2_x005d_.activityDescription:
Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • Girl Scout Promise and Law

  • Poster Board with the Promise and Law

  • Brownie Adventure Map

    • Steps:

    Invite girls to gather in the Brownie Ring/Circle

    SAY:

  • Welcome to our second Girl Scout Brownie meeting. I am so happy to see your great big Brownie smiles. Are you excited to find out what we’ll be doing at today’s meeting?

  • Let’s start out by reciting the Girl Scout Promise and Law.

  • Did anyone have a chance to practice at home since our last meeting?

    • Normally the girl who is listed on the Kaper Chart for the “Opening” would lead the group in the Opening Ceremony. She may or may not be ready to do this yet. Ask her if she would like to lead the group in reciting the Girl Scout Promise and Law. If she isn’t ready, ask if someone else would like to lead the group or if they would rather repeat the Girl Scout Promise and Law after you.

    Recite: The Girl Scout Promise

    Recite: The Girl Scout Law

  • Now, are you ready to start our Brownie Adventure for this year?

    • Hold up the Girl Scout Brownie Adventure Map. Show all the fun things to do on the path as you talk about each.

  • Here is a map that shows some of the fun things we’ll be able to do this year. We are going to set out on our big Brownie Adventure and along the way we’ll have the opportunity to sell cookies, to take trips, and to explore the outdoors.

  • Just like on any adventure, we’ll have lots of opportunities to choose the path we want to take.

  • You have an important choice to make today. You need to choose what our Brownie year is going to look like. I’m going to guide you through the kind of adventures you can have during the year, then you’ll make a decision as a team to choose one.

  • Are you ready to find out more about these different adventures?

  • Awesome! We have four activity stations set up, representing the four choices. You will have the chance to learn about each adventure and at the end of our meeting you will get to vote for your favorite.

  • Does that sound good?

  • Great! Let’s get started.

    • [[Activity
collection-element_x005b_2_x005d_.name: Opening Ceremony

collection-element_x005b_3_x005d_.activityDescription:
Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • Brownie Badges

  • 1 or 2 small bags of original flavored Skittles

  • Bowl or bag

    • Steps:

    Show the Brownie Badges Handout as you talk about the badges girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • This activity will give you more information about the Brownie Badges.

  • If we choose this adventure, we will be able to earn badges for learning new skills, like hiking by earning the Hiker badge, how to be a better friend by earning the Make New Friends Badge, how to do science experiments by earning the Home Scientist badge, and there are more badge choices if we decide we’d rather learn other skills. During the year, you could earn three badges, plus earn the My Promise, My Faith award, a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • One of the badges we can earn is called Making Friends. We are going to do an activity like the ones you’ll do to earn this badge.

  • The first thing you do when you are making friends is to get to know each other better.

  • Let’s play a game to find out a little more about what our Brownie Friends enjoy doing.

  • I am going to pass the bag (bowl) of Skittles around and you can draw out one Skittle. Depending on what color you draw, you’ll tell everyone something fun about yourself.

  • Red Skittle= Share a favorite pet or animal

  • Orange Skittle= Share a favorite sport or activity

  • Purple Skittle= Share your special talent/skill

  • Yellow Skittle= Share your favorite place to visit

  • Green Skittle= Share your favorite food

    • Pass the bag clockwise around the circle or hold the bowl over girls’ heads so they can pick without seeing the color. Start with yourself, say your name, pick a Skittle, share your fun fact based on the color of the Skittle. After each girl shares, she can eat her Skittle.

    Variation: You can use items other than Skittles, such as small toys, stickers, etc., which the girls can keep.

    You’ll need five different objects for girls to choose from. For example, if they’re picking small plastic animals, you could say, “Depending on the animal you choose, you’ll tell everyone something fun about yourself.”

  • Pig = Share a favorite pet or animal

  • Horse = Share a favorite sport or activity

  • Cow = Share your special talent/skill

  • Goose = Share your favorite place to visit

  • Rooster = Share your favorite food

    • SAY:

  • The Making Friends badge is just one of many badges you can choose from. There are also badges for hiking, making pottery, pet care and so much more.

  • If you choose the badge path, you will learn new skills and then you will use those skills to find a way to make a difference in the world by taking action and doing a project that you care about.

    • [[Activity
collection-element_x005b_3_x005d_.name: Brownie Badge Year

collection-element_x005b_4_x005d_.activityDescription:
Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • A World of Girls Journey Awards

  • Map or globe with countries and states clearly visible

  • Biscuits, scones, shortbread or other English snack

    • Steps:

    Show the World of Girls Journey Awards Handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • Now we’re going to learning about what you’ll be doing if you choose A World of Girls.

  • You’ll learn about girls all over the world through stories, books, TV shows, movies and online sites. You’ll look for clues in those stories that tell us what life is like for girls all around the world. And you’ll get to try some food from other countries.

  • Then you’ll decide how you can help make life better for girls.

  • You’ll be able to earn four awards. The names of the awards are Hear a Story, Tell a Story, Change a Story and the Better World for Girls Award.

  • During the year, you’ll also have time to earn badges for learning about money and running your cookie business.

  • Let’s do an activity that will help us get a taste for A World of Girls.

  • Does anyone know who started the Girl Scouts?

  • Her name was Juliette Gordon Low but she was nicknamed Daisy by her family.

  • Juliette (Daisy) Low grew up in Savannah, Georgia.

  • Can anyone point to Georgia on the map?

  • Juliette had two friends, Sir Robert Baden-Powell and his sister Agnes. In 1910 Lord Baden Powell and his sister Agnes started the Boy Scouts and the Girl Guides in England.

  • Juliette Gordon Low visited England to see her friends and learned about the Boy Scouts and the Girl Guides. That’s what happees when you tavel. You meet people from other places. You see different parts of the world. And you get all kinds of new ideas!

  • Can anyone point to England on the map?

  • Has anyone ever been to England?

  • Does anyone have family that comes from England?

  • In England, people have tea 4:00 in the afternoon. They usually eat biscuits, scones or shortbread with their tea. Would you like to taste a little sample?

    • IF THERE’S TIME, ASK:

  • Where are your families from? Your parents, your grandparents, your great-grandparents? Would anyone like to show on the map and share a country where your family came from?

    • Let girls share where their families are from and show the country on the map.

  • If you choose this Journey, you’ll find out about girls all over the world — what they like to eat, the games they like to play, and what their daily life is like.

  • You’ll hear stories about how they made a difference in the world — and you’ll get a chance to make a difference, too!

    • Variation: Tell girls about the Brownie Troop in Purvis, MS that used their cookie money to purchase a handicapped accessible swing and petitioned the City Council so they could install it. They came up with that idea while doing the A World of Girls Journey.

    [[Activity
collection-element_x005b_4_x005d_.name: A World of Girls Journey Year

collection-element_x005b_5_x005d_.activityDescription:
Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials:

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Two bottles of water (one clean and one with dirt and leaves)

    • Steps:

    SAY:

  • Ready to learn about this adventure?

  • I’ll give you some clues and you can guess what you think I am describing. Are you ready? Here are the clues.

  • Without me, the earth would look like the moon.

  • When I'm clean, I am colorless, odorless and tasteless.

  • I take up more than half of your body.

  • I cover more than 80% of the earth.

  • I fall from the sky.

  • Does anyone think they know what I am talking about?

  • That’s right! It’s water.

    • Show girls the clean bottle of water. Show the Wonders of Water Journey Awards Handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

  • Welcome to the Wonders of Water Journey .

  • If we choose this adventure, we will find out how to love water, save water, and share water, and you will earn awards too. You will earn four awards, the Share Water award, the Save Water award, the Love Water award and the WOW award. You will also earn a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • Let’s learn a little more about this Journey.

  • Raise your hand if you love water.

  • Let’s play a little game.

  • Everyone who likes to go or wants to try swimming make the swimming motion with your hands.

  • Everyone who likes to go or wants to try boating, sit down and pretend to row a boat.

  • Everyone who like to go or wants to try snorkeling, plug you nose and hold your breath. Remember water can be liquid like when you go swimming and when water freezes it makes snow and ice.

  • Everyone who likes to play in the snow, pretend to make and throw a snowball.

  • Everyone who likes to go ice skating (or wants to try it), pretend to ice-skate.

  • Everyone who likes to go skiing (or wants to try it), make the skiing motion

  • What do you think it would be like if the water that you loved to swim in and drink wasn’t clean?

  • What if it was dirty like this?

    • Show girls the bottle of dirty water.

  • Would you want to drink this water?

  • Would you want to swim in this water?

    • If you choose this Journey, you will be able to learn about all kinds of fun ways to love water, save water and share water. Did you know that a group of Brownies in Pennsylvania got their second-grade classroom to conserve water and switch to re-usable bottles while they were on the WOW Journey? From there, their efforts rippled out to the school and then the district and pretty soon the whole school district was recycling and saving water.

    Variation: Show the girls some videos of other Brownie Girl Scout Troops share about their Wonder of Water project.

    [[Activity
collection-element_x005b_5_x005d_.name: WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Year

collection-element_x005b_6_x005d_.activityDescription:
Time Allotment

  • 15 minutes

    • Materials

  • Brownie Quest Journey Awards

  • Brownie ELF Clues

  • Apples ( 1 apple per 3 girls)

  • Apple corer (to core and slice the apples)

  • Peanut Butter (for peanut allergies substitute frosting or cream cheese)

  • Bag of small white marshmallows

  • Plastic knives

  • Small baggies

    • Steps:

    Show the Brownie Quest Journey Awards handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • Welcome to the Introduction to the Brownie Quest Journey

  • If we choose this adventure, we’ll learn how to make the world a better place. You’ll earn four awards on this Journey but they’re a mystery! I can’t tell you what they are; you will have to choose the Brownie Quest Journey in order to find out. You’ll also earn a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • Let’s find out a little more about the Brownie Quest Journey

  • Even before Girl Scouts, there were Brownies who helped people, just like in the story we read at our last meeting.

  • In Girl Scout Brownie stories, there is always one magical elf with one very big job: making girls see that they are capable of remarkable things, especially if they team up.

  • Are you ready to go on your first ELF adventure?

  • Today, you will be on a quest for the missing Brownie Smile.

  • The Brownie Smile has gone missing and it’s up to you to form your very own ELF team of three girls to find it.

  • You will be on a quest to find the three ingredients to make your Brownie Smile snack.

  • So go ahead and get in groups of threes and then each team come and get your clues.

  • E.L.F stands for Explore, Link Arms, and Fly into Action!

  • So link arms, go explore by using the three clues to find your three ingredients and then we will fly into action to make our Brownie Smile snack.

    • Have each team of three get a clue. Send them on their quest to find the three ingredients for their Brownie Smile snack. After each team has found all three of their ingredients have them gather at the snack area.

  • Congratulations! You’ve found all three clues and you have unlocked the Brownie Smile Song.

  • Let me teach it to you: I will say one line at a time and you repeat after me and then we will try it all together.

    • Sing the Brownie Smile Song

    Brownie Smile Song

    I’ve something in my pocket.

    It belongs across my face.

    And I keep it very close at hand

    In a most convenient place.

    I’m sure you couldn’t guess it

    If you guessed a long, long while.

    So I’ll take it out and put it on-

    It’s a great big Brownie Smile!

  • Now you’re probably wondering what you have found and how these ingredients could possibly be the missing Brownie Smile.

  • Can anyone guess how we can make these ingredients into a Brownie Smile?

    • Show the girls how to make the Brownie Smile with their three ingredients.

    Instructions for making the Brownie Smile snack

  • Use the apple corer to core and slice the apples.

  • Use the plastic knife to spread a small amount of peanut butter (or substitute) on one side of one slice of apple

  • Place 6 marshmallows into the peanut butter (or substitute) on the apple to look like teeth.

  • Take another slice of apple and spread a small amount of peanut butter (or substitute) on one side of the apple

  • Put the second apple with peanut butter (or substitute) on top of the six marshmallows and sandwich together.

    • Note: the girl who is listed as the hostess on the Kaper chart can pass out napkins or paper plates or any other snack supplies.

    As girls enjoy their snack, show the video “Where the Sidewalk Ends”-Brownie Quest Take Action Project.

    If you can’t show the video at the meeting, watch it ahead of time and tell girls about Brownies who got their city to build a sidewalk to make their neighborhood safer. They did that while on the Brownie Quest Journey.

  • If you choose the Brownie Quest Journey, you’ll be able to decide what you care about as a team and fly into action to make the world a better place.

    • After the girls finish eating, let them suggest ways to tidy the room (throw away trash, push in chairs, sweep, put away supplies, etc). Give them time to clean up and then ask them to come back to the Brownie Ring for the closing ceremony.

    [[Activity
collection-element_x005b_6_x005d_.name: The Brownie Quest Journey Year

detailed_x0020_activity_x0020_plan.str:
detailed activity plan]]

[[Activity|1|”As Girls Arrive”]]

Materials

  • Brownie Elf Kaper Chart template

  • Kaper Chart

  • Scissors

  • Crayons/markers/colored pencils

  • Masking Tape

  • Poster Board Kaper Chart

    • Time Allotment

  • 5 minutes

    • Steps:

    Have the supplies setup for girls to color their Elf Kaper square so that girls can start coloring them as they wait for others to arrive.

    Instructions:

    Let girls color the elf any way they’d like.

    Have each girl write her name on the line.

    The first girls to arrive at the meeting can choose the kaper they’d like to do at today’s meeting by placing their elf on the Kaper Chart. The remaining girls will be rotated in for all future meetings so that everyone gets a turn to try all the kapers.

    [[Activity|2|”Opening Ceremony”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • Girl Scout Promise and Law

  • Poster Board with the Promise and Law

  • Brownie Adventure Map

    • Steps:

    Invite girls to gather in the Brownie Ring/Circle

    SAY:

  • Welcome to our second Girl Scout Brownie meeting. I am so happy to see your great big Brownie smiles. Are you excited to find out what we’ll be doing at today’s meeting?

  • Let’s start out by reciting the Girl Scout Promise and Law.

  • Did anyone have a chance to practice at home since our last meeting?

    • Normally the girl who is listed on the Kaper Chart for the “Opening” would lead the group in the Opening Ceremony. She may or may not be ready to do this yet. Ask her if she would like to lead the group in reciting the Girl Scout Promise and Law. If she isn’t ready, ask if someone else would like to lead the group or if they would rather repeat the Girl Scout Promise and Law after you.

    Recite: The Girl Scout Promise

    Recite: The Girl Scout Law

  • Now, are you ready to start our Brownie Adventure for this year?

    • Hold up the Girl Scout Brownie Adventure Map. Show all the fun things to do on the path as you talk about each.

  • Here is a map that shows some of the fun things we’ll be able to do this year. We are going to set out on our big Brownie Adventure and along the way we’ll have the opportunity to sell cookies, to take trips, and to explore the outdoors.

  • Just like on any adventure, we’ll have lots of opportunities to choose the path we want to take.

  • You have an important choice to make today. You need to choose what our Brownie year is going to look like. I’m going to guide you through the kind of adventures you can have during the year, then you’ll make a decision as a team to choose one.

  • Are you ready to find out more about these different adventures?

  • Awesome! We have four activity stations set up, representing the four choices. You will have the chance to learn about each adventure and at the end of our meeting you will get to vote for your favorite.

  • Does that sound good?

  • Great! Let’s get started.

    • [[Activity|3|”Brownie Badge Year”|10]]

    Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • Brownie Badges

  • 1 or 2 small bags of original flavored Skittles

  • Bowl or bag

    • Steps:

    Show the Brownie Badges Handout as you talk about the badges girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • This activity will give you more information about the Brownie Badges.

  • If we choose this adventure, we will be able to earn badges for learning new skills, like hiking by earning the Hiker badge, how to be a better friend by earning the Make New Friends Badge, how to do science experiments by earning the Home Scientist badge, and there are more badge choices if we decide we’d rather learn other skills. During the year, you could earn three badges, plus earn the My Promise, My Faith award, a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • One of the badges we can earn is called Making Friends. We are going to do an activity like the ones you’ll do to earn this badge.

  • The first thing you do when you are making friends is to get to know each other better.

  • Let’s play a game to find out a little more about what our Brownie Friends enjoy doing.

  • I am going to pass the bag (bowl) of Skittles around and you can draw out one Skittle. Depending on what color you draw, you’ll tell everyone something fun about yourself.

  • Red Skittle= Share a favorite pet or animal

  • Orange Skittle= Share a favorite sport or activity

  • Purple Skittle= Share your special talent/skill

  • Yellow Skittle= Share your favorite place to visit

  • Green Skittle= Share your favorite food

    • Pass the bag clockwise around the circle or hold the bowl over girls’ heads so they can pick without seeing the color. Start with yourself, say your name, pick a Skittle, share your fun fact based on the color of the Skittle. After each girl shares, she can eat her Skittle.

    Variation: You can use items other than Skittles, such as small toys, stickers, etc., which the girls can keep.

    You’ll need five different objects for girls to choose from. For example, if they’re picking small plastic animals, you could say, “Depending on the animal you choose, you’ll tell everyone something fun about yourself.”

  • Pig = Share a favorite pet or animal

  • Horse = Share a favorite sport or activity

  • Cow = Share your special talent/skill

  • Goose = Share your favorite place to visit

  • Rooster = Share your favorite food

    • SAY:

  • The Making Friends badge is just one of many badges you can choose from. There are also badges for hiking, making pottery, pet care and so much more.

  • If you choose the badge path, you will learn new skills and then you will use those skills to find a way to make a difference in the world by taking action and doing a project that you care about.

    • [[Activity|4|”A World of Girls Journey Year”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials

  • A World of Girls Journey Awards

  • Map or globe with countries and states clearly visible

  • Biscuits, scones, shortbread or other English snack

    • Steps:

    Show the World of Girls Journey Awards Handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • Now we’re going to learning about what you’ll be doing if you choose A World of Girls.

  • You’ll learn about girls all over the world through stories, books, TV shows, movies and online sites. You’ll look for clues in those stories that tell us what life is like for girls all around the world. And you’ll get to try some food from other countries.

  • Then you’ll decide how you can help make life better for girls.

  • You’ll be able to earn four awards. The names of the awards are Hear a Story, Tell a Story, Change a Story and the Better World for Girls Award.

  • During the year, you’ll also have time to earn badges for learning about money and running your cookie business.

  • Let’s do an activity that will help us get a taste for A World of Girls.

  • Does anyone know who started the Girl Scouts?

  • Her name was Juliette Gordon Low but she was nicknamed Daisy by her family.

  • Juliette (Daisy) Low grew up in Savannah, Georgia.

  • Can anyone point to Georgia on the map?

  • Juliette had two friends, Sir Robert Baden-Powell and his sister Agnes. In 1910 Lord Baden Powell and his sister Agnes started the Boy Scouts and the Girl Guides in England.

  • Juliette Gordon Low visited England to see her friends and learned about the Boy Scouts and the Girl Guides. That’s what happees when you tavel. You meet people from other places. You see different parts of the world. And you get all kinds of new ideas!

  • Can anyone point to England on the map?

  • Has anyone ever been to England?

  • Does anyone have family that comes from England?

  • In England, people have tea 4:00 in the afternoon. They usually eat biscuits, scones or shortbread with their tea. Would you like to taste a little sample?

    • IF THERE’S TIME, ASK:

  • Where are your families from? Your parents, your grandparents, your great-grandparents? Would anyone like to show on the map and share a country where your family came from?

    • Let girls share where their families are from and show the country on the map.

  • If you choose this Journey, you’ll find out about girls all over the world — what they like to eat, the games they like to play, and what their daily life is like.

  • You’ll hear stories about how they made a difference in the world — and you’ll get a chance to make a difference, too!

    • Variation: Tell girls about the Brownie Troop in Purvis, MS that used their cookie money to purchase a handicapped accessible swing and petitioned the City Council so they could install it. They came up with that idea while doing the A World of Girls Journey.

    [[Activity|5|”WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Year”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 10 minutes

    • Materials:

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Two bottles of water (one clean and one with dirt and leaves)

    • Steps:

    SAY:

  • Ready to learn about this adventure?

  • I’ll give you some clues and you can guess what you think I am describing. Are you ready? Here are the clues.

  • Without me, the earth would look like the moon.

  • When I'm clean, I am colorless, odorless and tasteless.

  • I take up more than half of your body.

  • I cover more than 80% of the earth.

  • I fall from the sky.

  • Does anyone think they know what I am talking about?

  • That’s right! It’s water.

    • Show girls the clean bottle of water. Show the Wonders of Water Journey Awards Handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

  • Welcome to the Wonders of Water Journey .

  • If we choose this adventure, we will find out how to love water, save water, and share water, and you will earn awards too. You will earn four awards, the Share Water award, the Save Water award, the Love Water award and the WOW award. You will also earn a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • Let’s learn a little more about this Journey.

  • Raise your hand if you love water.

  • Let’s play a little game.

  • Everyone who likes to go or wants to try swimming make the swimming motion with your hands.

  • Everyone who likes to go or wants to try boating, sit down and pretend to row a boat.

  • Everyone who like to go or wants to try snorkeling, plug you nose and hold your breath. Remember water can be liquid like when you go swimming and when water freezes it makes snow and ice.

  • Everyone who likes to play in the snow, pretend to make and throw a snowball.

  • Everyone who likes to go ice skating (or wants to try it), pretend to ice-skate.

  • Everyone who likes to go skiing (or wants to try it), make the skiing motion

  • What do you think it would be like if the water that you loved to swim in and drink wasn’t clean?

  • What if it was dirty like this?

    • Show girls the bottle of dirty water.

  • Would you want to drink this water?

  • Would you want to swim in this water?

    • If you choose this Journey, you will be able to learn about all kinds of fun ways to love water, save water and share water. Did you know that a group of Brownies in Pennsylvania got their second-grade classroom to conserve water and switch to re-usable bottles while they were on the WOW Journey? From there, their efforts rippled out to the school and then the district and pretty soon the whole school district was recycling and saving water.

    Variation: Show the girls some videos of other Brownie Girl Scout Troops share about their Wonder of Water project.

    [[Activity|6|”The Brownie Quest Journey Year”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 15 minutes

    • Materials

  • Brownie Quest Journey Awards

  • Brownie ELF Clues

  • Apples ( 1 apple per 3 girls)

  • Apple corer (to core and slice the apples)

  • Peanut Butter (for peanut allergies substitute frosting or cream cheese)

  • Bag of small white marshmallows

  • Plastic knives

  • Small baggies

    • Steps:

    Show the Brownie Quest Journey Awards handout as you talk about the Awards girls can earn.

    SAY:

  • Welcome to the Introduction to the Brownie Quest Journey

  • If we choose this adventure, we’ll learn how to make the world a better place. You’ll earn four awards on this Journey but they’re a mystery! I can’t tell you what they are; you will have to choose the Brownie Quest Journey in order to find out. You’ll also earn a badge for learning about money, and a badge for running your cookie business.

  • Let’s find out a little more about the Brownie Quest Journey

  • Even before Girl Scouts, there were Brownies who helped people, just like in the story we read at our last meeting.

  • In Girl Scout Brownie stories, there is always one magical elf with one very big job: making girls see that they are capable of remarkable things, especially if they team up.

  • Are you ready to go on your first ELF adventure?

  • Today, you will be on a quest for the missing Brownie Smile.

  • The Brownie Smile has gone missing and it’s up to you to form your very own ELF team of three girls to find it.

  • You will be on a quest to find the three ingredients to make your Brownie Smile snack.

  • So go ahead and get in groups of threes and then each team come and get your clues.

  • E.L.F stands for Explore, Link Arms, and Fly into Action!

  • So link arms, go explore by using the three clues to find your three ingredients and then we will fly into action to make our Brownie Smile snack.

    • Have each team of three get a clue. Send them on their quest to find the three ingredients for their Brownie Smile snack. After each team has found all three of their ingredients have them gather at the snack area.

  • Congratulations! You’ve found all three clues and you have unlocked the Brownie Smile Song.

  • Let me teach it to you: I will say one line at a time and you repeat after me and then we will try it all together.

    • Sing the Brownie Smile Song

    Brownie Smile Song

    I’ve something in my pocket.

    It belongs across my face.

    And I keep it very close at hand

    In a most convenient place.

    I’m sure you couldn’t guess it

    If you guessed a long, long while.

    So I’ll take it out and put it on-

    It’s a great big Brownie Smile!

  • Now you’re probably wondering what you have found and how these ingredients could possibly be the missing Brownie Smile.

  • Can anyone guess how we can make these ingredients into a Brownie Smile?

    • Show the girls how to make the Brownie Smile with their three ingredients.

    Instructions for making the Brownie Smile snack

  • Use the apple corer to core and slice the apples.

  • Use the plastic knife to spread a small amount of peanut butter (or substitute) on one side of one slice of apple

  • Place 6 marshmallows into the peanut butter (or substitute) on the apple to look like teeth.

  • Take another slice of apple and spread a small amount of peanut butter (or substitute) on one side of the apple

  • Put the second apple with peanut butter (or substitute) on top of the six marshmallows and sandwich together.

    • Note: the girl who is listed as the hostess on the Kaper chart can pass out napkins or paper plates or any other snack supplies.

    As girls enjoy their snack, show the video “Where the Sidewalk Ends”-Brownie Quest Take Action Project.

    If you can’t show the video at the meeting, watch it ahead of time and tell girls about Brownies who got their city to build a sidewalk to make their neighborhood safer. They did that while on the Brownie Quest Journey.

  • If you choose the Brownie Quest Journey, you’ll be able to decide what you care about as a team and fly into action to make the world a better place.

    • After the girls finish eating, let them suggest ways to tidy the room (throw away trash, push in chairs, sweep, put away supplies, etc). Give them time to clean up and then ask them to come back to the Brownie Ring for the closing ceremony.

    [[Activity|7|”It’s Your Brownie Adventure — Choose it!”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 15 minutes

    • Materials

  • Brownie Badges

  • A World of Girls Journey Awards

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Brownie Quest Journey Awards

  • Sticky dots, stickers or post it notes (1 per girl)

  • Tape

    • Steps

  • OK, girls! It’s decision time. It is time to for you to work as a team and choose your Brownie Adventure.

  • Let’s take a quick minute to review the four choices. Then you’ll vote for your favorite.

    • Show the Brownie Quest handout

  • When we go on the Brownie Quest Journey, we’ll play games, read stories, and learn about ourselves and others. You’ll learn how to care for yourselves, your families, your Girl Scout sisters, and your community.

    • Share the WOW! Wonders of Water Journey handout

  • When we go on the Wonders of Water Journey, we’ll discover all the ways we love water, save water, and share water! We’ll explore the science of water and how we can share what we know with others. Plus, we’ll have a chance to explore the great outdoors!

    • Share the World of Girls Journey handout

  • When we go on the World of Girls Journey, we’ll learn about girls around the world and how stories can give you ideas for helping others. We might hear stories, change stories, or write our own stories. And at the end, we’ll all have a story to tell about how we helped others!

    • Share the Brownie Badges handout

  • You learn how to do all kinds of things when you earn badges. If you choose the Brownie Badge Year, you’ll decide what badges you want to earn, and then be able to use what you learned to help other people.

    • Tape the handouts around the room at a height that the girls can reach.

    SAY:

  • Are you ready to vote?

  • Find a partner that you haven’t worked with yet.

    • Give each pair of girls two sticky dots.

    SAY:

  • Now, link arms with your partner.

  • Brownies on the left side of your partner raise your hands.

  • Whisper in your partner’s ear which choice you want to vote for.

  • Partners on the right, do you know what your partner wants to choose?

  • Great, stay linked arm in arm and fly into action by skipping to the paper that shows the adventure that your partner likes best and put one of your sticky dots on the sheet of paper.

  • When you are done, stay linked together and hop back to the circle.

  • Ready, set, go!

    • Let girls vote. Remind girls they are only voting for the partners on the left and then they should come back to the circle when they are done voting.

    SAY:

  • Great! Now partners on the right side, raise your hands.

  • Partners on the right, whisper in your partner’s ear, the choice that you want to vote for.

  • Partners on the left, do you know what your partner wants to choose?

  • Ok! Stay linked arm in arm and fly into action by flapping your free arm like a bird to the paper that shows the adventure that your partner likes best and put your last sticky dot on the sheet of paper.

  • When you’re done, stay linked arm in arm and walk backward to the circle and sit down.

    • Bring all the voting sheets to the circle so the girls can see the results.

    SAY:

  • Does it look like a lot of you are interested in the same adventure? Which one?

  • Is there an adventure that only got a few votes or none at all that someone really wanted to try? Would you like to tell the group why you wish that choice got more votes?

  • How do you think we can make a final decision that our whole Brownie troop will be happy about?

    • Coach girls to come to an agreement and make a decision.

  • Congratulations, girls! You have shown excellent leadership skills in coming to an agreement and making your choice. I think you will really enjoy this choice.

  • Are you excited?

  • Me, too! At our next meeting we will start our new adventure.

    • [[Activity|8|”Closing Ceremony”]]

    Time Allotment

  • 5 minutes

    • Materials

  • None

    • Note: The girl who is listed on the Kaper Chart for closing will be the one who starts the Friendship Squeeze.

    Steps

    Gather girls in a Friendship Circle. Girl Scouts and leaders stand in a circle, each crossing her right arm over her left and holding the hands of the person next to her. Sing “Make New Friends.”

    Make New Friends

    Make new friends, but keep the old.

    One is silver and the other’s gold.

    A circle’s round, it has no end.

    That’s how long I want to be your friend.

    After everyone is quiet, the girl in charge of the closing ceremony will start a friendship squeeze by squeezing her neighbor’s hand with her right hand. One by one, each girl passes on the squeeze until it travels all around the circle. The girl who began the squeeze says, “Goodbye, Brownie Girl Scouts.” Everyone raises their joined hands and twists clockwise out of the circle so that everyone is untwisted and facing away from the circle.

    REMIND THE GIRLS:

  • When the next meeting will be.

Activity 1: As Girls Arrive

  • Crayons/markers/colored pencils

  • Masking tape

  • Poster Board Kaper Chart

    • Activity 2: Opening Ceremony — Our Big Adventure

  • Brownie Adventure Map

    • Activity 3: Sample Activity — Brownie Badge Year

  • 1 or 2 small bags of original flavored Skittles

  • Bowl or bag

    • Activity 4: Sample Activity — A World of Girls Journey Year

  • Map or globe with countries and states clearly visible

  • Biscuits, scones, shortbread or other English snack

    • Activity 5: Sample Activity — WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Year

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

    • Activity 6: Sample Activity — Brownie Quest Journey Year

    • Activity 7: Team Decision: Choose Your Brownie Track

  • Brownie Badges

  • WOW! Wonders of Water Journey Awards

  • Tape

overview.str:
overview]]

This meeting will introduce girls to the Girl Scout Leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges so they can choose a Brownie “track” for the year.

In this meeting, girls will:

  • Be introduced to all three leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges

  • Do sample activities from each of the three Journeys and a sample badge activity

  • Choose one of four tracks to help plan their year.

    • Prepare Ahead

  • Pre-cut the Brownie Elf Kaper template so they are ready for girls to color.

  • Make a simple Kaper Chart on poster board with the dates of your meeting along the left side and the jobs along the top, such as opening, hostess, clean-up, closing.

  • Post the Girl Scout Promise and Law on Poster Board so the girls can read it from the Brownie Circle.

  • Put the Skittles in a bowl or a bag for activity 3.

  • For activity 5, pour some water out of one water bottle, add some dirt and leaves, put the cap on and shake it up.

  • For the Brownie Smile snack, prepare enough baggies of peanut butter and baggies of marshmallows (18 in each baggie) for each group of three to have one.

  • Hide the apples and baggies in places where they’re fairly easy to find.

  • Prepare the Brownie ELF Clues handout.

    • Get Help from Your Friends and Family Network

    Your Friends and Family Network can include:

  • The Brownies’ parents, aunts, uncles, older siblings, etc.

  • Cadettes who are interested in earning their LiA Award

  • Other volunteers who have offered to help with the meeting

    • Ask them how they can pitch in. For example, they might want to:

  • Bring snacks

  • Help welcome girls to the meeting

  • Gather materials for activities

  • Guide the girls in one of the activities

  • Or just be ready to take care of small problems (spilled juice!), hand out art supplies (share the crayons, please!) or act as cheerleaders!

    • Tip: This meeting will take the full 1 ½ hours, so plan accordingly. Try to recruit a few adults to help at the meeting keep things running smoothly. If you have a large group of girls and enough adult helpers, you may consider splitting the girls up into three groups for activities 3,4, and 5 and running the activities as 10-minute stations. The three groups would rotate through the stations and then come back together as a group for activity number 6. There will be several small snacks that girls will eat throughout the meeting.

    Award Connection

    Girls will be doing activities to help them make decisions to plan their troop year. Girls will decide whether they want to choose a Journey track or the badge track.

    There are three Journey tracks: Brownie Quest, WOW! Wonders of Water, and A World of Girls. On a Journey track, girls will be able to complete a Journey, including a Take Action project, and earn a couple of badges.

    On a badge track, girls earn a number of badges and complete a small Take Action project.

    Meeting Length

    90 minutes, including 10 minutes for setup and cleanup.

    If girls were Brownies last year and have already completed a Journey, just omit that Journey as a choice for this year and spend more time on the other activities.

    The times given for each activity will be different, depending on how many girls are in the troop.

    [[_

B14B015_0.7831902135179192.agenda: \[1-Opening Ceremony-10] [2-Make Something Bubble Up-10] [3-Homemade Silly Putty-20] [4-Snack Chat-10] [5-Take Action Pause-10] [6-Closing Ceremony-5]

overview.str:
overview]]

This meeting will introduce girls to the Girl Scout Leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges so they can choose a Brownie “track” for the year.

In this meeting, girls will:

  • Be introduced to all three leadership Journeys and the Brownie badges

  • Do sample activities from each of the three Journeys and a sample badge activity

  • Choose one of four tracks to help plan their year.

    • Prepare Ahead

  • Pre-cut the Brownie Elf Kaper template so they are ready for girls to color.

  • Make a simple Kaper Chart on poster board with the dates of your meeting along the left side and the jobs along the top, such as opening, hostess, clean-up, closing.

  • Post the Girl Scout Promise and Law on Poster Board so the girls can read it from the Brownie Circle.

  • Put the Skittles in a bowl or a bag for activity 3.

  • For activity 5, pour some water out of one water bottle, add some dirt and leaves, put the cap on and shake it up.

  • For the Brownie Smile snack, prepare enough baggies of peanut butter and baggies of marshmallows (18 in each baggie) for each group of three to have one.

  • Hide the apples and baggies in places where they’re fairly easy to find.

  • Prepare the Brownie ELF Clues handout.

    • Get Help from Your Friends and Family Network

    Your Friends and Family Network can include:

  • The Brownies’ parents, aunts, uncles, older siblings, etc.

  • Cadettes who are interested in earning their LiA Award

  • Other volunteers who have offered to help with the meeting

    • Ask them how they can pitch in. For example, they might want to:

  • Bring snacks

  • Help welcome girls to the meeting

  • Gather materials for activities

  • Guide the girls in one of the activities

  • Or just be ready to take care of small problems (spilled juice!), hand out art supplies (share the crayons, please!) or act as cheerleaders!

    • Tip: This meeting will take the full 1 ½ hours, so plan accordingly. Try to recruit a few adults to help at the meeting keep things running smoothly. If you have a large group of girls and enough adult helpers, you may consider splitting the girls up into three groups for activities 3,4, and 5 and running the activities as 10-minute stations. The three groups would rotate through the stations and then come back together as a group for activity number 6. There will be several small snacks that girls will eat throughout the meeting.

    Award Connection

    Girls will be doing activities to help them make decisions to plan their troop year. Girls will decide whether they want to choose a Journey track or the badge track.

    There are three Journey tracks: Brownie Quest, WOW! Wonders of Water, and A World of Girls. On a Journey track, girls will be able to complete a Journey, including a Take Action project, and earn a couple of badges.

    On a badge track, girls earn a number of badges and complete a small Take Action project.

    Meeting Length

    90 minutes, including 10 minutes for setup and cleanup.

    If girls were Brownies last year and have already completed a Journey, just omit that Journey as a choice for this year and spend more time on the other activities.

    The times given for each activity will be different, depending on how many girls are in the troop.

    [[_
